turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm looking for some new shoes, but I'm so overwhelmed by all the options. I generally like a classic, minimalist style. Can you recommend something?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I understand. For a classic, minimalist style, I would suggest looking at leather Chelsea boots, simple white sneakers, or classic ballet flats. Do any of those appeal to you more than the others?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, the white sneakers sound good. But there are SO many white sneakers! I want something that goes with everything, but isn't *boring*. Like, elevated basics, you know?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Elevated basics, got it. How about considering white sneakers with a gum sole? That adds a touch of visual interest while still being versatile. Or perhaps a pair with subtle textured leather?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, the gum sole is interesting... What brands should I be looking at? This is where I always get stuck. There's Adidas, Nike, but they all seem so sporty. I don't want to look like I'm going to the gym, just grabbing coffee!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: For sneakers that are less sporty and more stylish, you might want to check out brands like Veja, Common Projects, or Everlane. They offer minimalist designs with high-quality materials. Alternatively, you could consider a more fashion-focused brand like Acne Studios or Golden Goose for a more statement sneaker, though they tend to be pricier. Does that help?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's actually really helpful! Thanks. I'll look into Veja and Common Projects. Appreciate the direction; I was totally lost before!
